result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Allen Kelley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

superMiscConds.notes: Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA Surcharge= payable from available prison monies.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored. No possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance, without a valid Rx, and only with prior agent approval. No contact with Co-deft's. No contact with known drug users or dealers, except in a treatment setting, and only with prior agent approval.
Maintain/obtain full time employment or school. Contact with D.V. to be determined by agent. Any other assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. DNA Sample Due: 5-25-22.

records.addlTxt:
1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Scott Allen Kelley in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott H Lyon in court for Scott Allen Kelley. 
Court calls case. 
Atty provides plea form.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty agrees.
DA reads charge on Count 2, with repeater and PTAC, but without second and subsequent enhancer. 
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters Guilty plea.
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
Elements of offense.
Court reviews prior convictions. 
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Atty satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty on Count 2, with repeater and PTAC, but without second and subsequent enhancer. 
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7. 
Court reviews PSI with deft.
Deft agrees to proceed without PSI. 
ADA heard on recommendation and sentencing.
Atty heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes: 2 Years 6 months IC, 2 Years ES, Concurrent to revocation.
Eligible for CIP and SAP. 
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Payment of $100.00 fine + costs + fees + DNA Surcharge= payable from available prison monies. 
No possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance, without a valid Rx, and only with prior agent approval. 
Maintain/obtain full time employment or school. 
No contact with Co-deft's.
No contact with known drug users or dealers, except in a treatment setting, and only with prior agent approval. 
Contact with D.V. to be determined by agent. 
Any other assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. 
DNA Sample Due: 5-25-22. 
148 days credit for time served.
Appeal rights.

Requests STC within the next few days.
